results.deck:
Remake of three titles in one: Decathlete, Winter Heat, and Virtua Athlete 2K.
Part of the Sega Ages 2500 series for the PS2
results.name: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.15: Decathlete Collection

results.deck: The last installment in the Cool Boarders series
results.name: Cool Boarders 2001

results.deck: Getting Up is a video game created by Atari and the Collective. It revolves around the main character, a punk named Trane, as he tries to take back the city of New Radius through the medium of vandalism.
results.name: Marc Ecko's Getting Up: Contents Under Pressure

results.deck: A racing game/minigame collection based vaguely on the 2006 Disney/Pixar movie Cars, and features the full movie voice cast. The game varies greatly between platforms, and features infamously blatant rubber banding from AI players.
results.name: Cars

results.deck: Released four years after the movie that inspired it, Antz Extreme Racing features, as you would expect, the pint-sized characters from Antz participating in high-speed racing events.
results.name: Antz Extreme Racing

results.deck: EyeToy: Play 2 is a mini-game collection that uses the Playstation 2 camera.
results.name: EyeToy: Play 2

results.deck: Yakuza, known in Japan as Ryu ga Gotoku (Like a Dragon), is an open-world action-adventure game with RPG elements, developed and published by Sega, in which you play the role of a Yakuza gangster known as Kazuma Kiryu. It was released in 2005.
results.name: Yakuza

results.deck: Dragon Quest V is a turn-based RPG released in 1992 and is the fifth installment in the popular Dragon Quest series. It is also the second entry in the Zenithia Trilogy, and one of the most popular games in the franchise.
results.name: Dragon Quest V: Hand of the Heavenly Bride

results.deck: NBA Live 06 is the first game in the franchise to reach next generation consoles.
results.name: NBA Live 06

results.deck: Klonoa 2 Is the sequel to the 2.5D platformer Klonoa: Door to Phantomile.
results.name: Klonoa 2: Lunatea's Veil

results.deck: Tony Hawk's American Wasteland is the 7th game in the Tony Hawk franchise released in 2005. Developed by Neversoft and published by Activision, it was the first Tony Hawk game to be released on the Xbox 360 and the last one for the Gamecube.
results.name: Tony Hawk's American Wasteland

results.deck: A young woman whose fiance recently died finds herself in a ghostly manor when she falls asleep, only to be stalked by a woman's tattoo-covered spirit.
results.name: Fatal Frame III: The Tormented

results.deck: Line up colored Puyos as you attempt to recover a magic wand in this puzzle game.
results.name: Puyo Pop Fever

results.deck: This edition of Gran Turismo was used exclusively for the 2002 Tokyo-Geneva Auto Show.
results.name: Gran Turismo Concept: 2002 Tokyo-Geneva
SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.8: V.R. Virtua Racing -FlatOut-

results.deck: A Visual Mix: Ayumi Hamasaki Dome Tour 2001 A is a concert simulator where you man cameras for a concert for Japanese performer Ayumi Hamasaki.
results.name: A Visual Mix: Ayumi Hamasaki Dome Tour 2001 A

results.deck: Van Helsing is a video game adaptation of the 2004 movie of the same name.
results.name: Van Helsing

results.deck: Red Ninja is a stealth action game in the vein of Tenchu. Developed as a collaboration between Tranji Studios and film writer Shinsuke Sato.
results.name: Red Ninja: End of Honor

results.deck: Metal Slug 5 is the fifth game in the series.
results.name: Metal Slug 5

results.deck: View and navigate photos of the Japanese idol Nemoto Harumi. Released in 2003.
results.name: Motion Gravure Series: Nemoto Harumi

results.deck: EA Sports NBA game
results.name: NBA Live 07

results.deck: A vertical-scrolling shoot em up, released in 1980.
results.name: Moon Cresta

results.deck: In Space Channel 5 the player takes control of Ulala, a TV diva who has to out-dance evil aliens and rescue hostages as she tries to get her TV ratings to soar. The game also features a cameo from Michael Jackson.
results.name: Space Channel 5

results.deck: Planned as the last game in the R- Type series, Final has you investigating a destroyed space colony and includes 101 different ships from throughout the R-type timeline.
results.name: R-Type Final

results.deck: In this game Players can  take control of 10 playable characters and each of them have their own unique caddy. The series is noted for crude humor, particularly in regard to the characters.
results.name: Outlaw Golf

results.deck: Called Gun Survivor 3: Dino Crisis in Japan, this dinosaur-blasting light gun shooter is the first Gun Survivor game to be released in North America.
results.name: Dino Stalker

results.deck: Set in the near future, Stolen stars a cat burglar named Anya who stumbles upon a conspiracy that threatens the entire city.
results.name: Stolen

results.deck: La Pucelle Tactics is a tactical role-playing game from the makers of Disgaea and Phantom Brave.
results.name: La Pucelle: Tactics

results.deck: Call of Duty 3 is a World War II-themed first-person shooter developed by Treyarch and published by Activision.
results.name: Call of Duty 3

results.deck: Take control of some of the most iconic superheroes of the Marvel Universe in this squad-based RPG. Form a well known group such as the Fantastic Four or create your own custom group of heroes to battle Dr. Doom and the Masters of Evil.
results.name: Marvel Ultimate Alliance

results.deck: Tenchu: Wrath of Heaven is the third Tenchu game and a sequel to the first installment. It had the same basic gameplay as the first two Tenchu games but modernized the movement controls.
results.name: Tenchu: Wrath of Heaven

results.deck: A football video game brought to you by Konami, Pro Evolution Soccer 4 features thousands of licensed players.
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 4

results.deck: Gamebreaker 2001 was the first college football game to be brought to the PS2 and featured "new millenium stadium and player models" that were "detailed to perfection." It had 115 Division 1-A teams and stadiums and more than 20 bowl games. Football is a game of Inches!
results.name: NCAA GameBreaker 2001

results.deck: A first-person shooter set in the Warhammer 40,000 universe. Follow a Tau Fire Warrior named Kais during a 24 hour period as he battles Imperial and Chaos forces to rescue the kidnapped Ethereal.
results.name: Warhammer 40,000: Fire Warrior

results.deck: An adaption of the novel-adapted movie of the same name. It consists of many levels, and 4 playable characters - Peter, Edmund, Susan and Lucy.
results.name: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

results.deck: Shut Your Mouth! is the fourth game in the Smackdown! Series and its second outing on the Playstation 2. It features the usual roster updates, tweaks to the control scheme, as well as a brand new season mode that improves greatly on the previous offering in the last game.
results.name: WWE SmackDown! Shut Your Mouth

results.deck: The third installment in the Legends of Wrestling series.
results.name: Showdown: Legends of Wrestling

results.deck: The third game in the SEGA AGES 2500 line, this is a remake of the side-scrolling shoot-em-up Fantasy Zone.
results.name: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.3: Fantasy Zone

results.deck: A weapons-based 2D fighting game that takes place late in Japan's Edo period, one year after the events of The Last Blade.
results.name: The Last Blade 2

results.deck: A third-person action game which intertwines the stories of The Animatrix, The Matrix: Reloaded and The Matrix: Revolutions.
results.name: Enter the Matrix

results.deck: Battle Engine Aquila is a science fiction game in which you pilot the Battle Engine for the Forseti military in their wars against the Muspell to decide who will rule what's left of the world.
results.name: Battle Engine Aquila

results.deck: Surf's Up is a multiplatform game developed by Ubisoft based on the movie of the same name. As a variety of avian characters from the movie, players compete in surfing challenges.
results.name: Surf's Up

results.deck: The King of Fighters 2002: Challenge to the Ultimate Battle is the ninth installment of the King of Fighters series and the second "Dream Match" entry, bringing back the traditional 3-on-3 structure of pre-1999 KOF games.
results.name: The King of Fighters 2002: Challenge to Ultimate Battle

results.deck: Play as both Spider-Man and Venom in this cel-shaded open-world action-adventure game with story written by comic writer Brian Michael Bendis.
results.name: Ultimate Spider-Man

results.deck: A platformer based on the disney film of the same name.
results.name: Disney's Treasure Planet

results.deck: The now widely available third installment to the Gradius franchise was the first to introduce customizable weapon sets and brief 2.5D action.
results.name: Gradius III

results.deck: A 3d version of the classic arcade game.
results.name: Frogger: Ancient Shadow

results.deck: Mercenaries: Playground of Destruction is a sandbox game set in a fictional North Korea which has been torn apart by a massive multinational war.
results.name: Mercenaries: Playground of Destruction

results.deck: Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks is a 3D action-adventure platformer and spin-off of the Mortal Kombat franchise, retelling the events of Mortal Kombat II as players assume the roles of the warriors Liu Kang and Kung Lao.
results.name: Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks

results.deck: A first-person turn-based RPG developed by Racjin and Atlus. It is inspired by Sir-Tech's venerable Wizardry series and features similar gameplay with a JRPG twist.
results.name: Wizardry: Tale of the Forsaken Land

results.deck: Join Crash on his latest quest to stop Dr. Cortex from his nefarious plans and rescue his sister Coco. Crash of the Titans features all new graphics and some serious platforming fun.
results.name: Crash of the Titans

results.deck: When Apocalypse and his Four Horsemen threaten the safety of the world, and Magneto's position of power, the X-Men and the Brotherhood of Mutants must team-up in order to combat this threat and ultimately save the world.
results.name: X-Men: Legends II - Rise of Apocalypse

results.deck: ESPN NHL 2K5 was the fifth game in the series, and featured Martin St.Louis on the cover who was a member of the 2004 Stanley Cup Champion Tampa Bay Lightning. He was also the winner of the Hart, Lester B. Pearson, and Art Ross Trophies that season.
results.name: ESPN NHL 2K5

results.deck: Berserk: Millennium Falcon Hen Seima Senki no Shou (Record of the Holy Demon War) is a PlayStation 2 game based on the Berserk Manga.
results.name: Berserk: Millennium Falcon Hen Seima Senki no Shou

results.deck: Gitaroo Man is a rhythm game that tells the extraordinary tale of a boy as he is joined by his talking dog to do battle against space sharks, smooth talking reggae bees, UFO's and others to defeat the evil Gravillian Empire and to ultimately impress the girl.
results.name: Gitaroo Man

results.deck: The third installment in the SingStar franchise, featuring pop hits from the past and present.
results.name: SingStar Popworld

results.deck: The seventh installment in the SingStar franchise, featuring the biggest songs from some of the biggest names in music.
results.name: Singstar Legends

results.deck: The second installment of Midway Arcade Treasures focuses on the company's biggest arcade games from the late 80s and the 90s.
results.name: Midway Arcade Treasures 2

results.deck: Star Wars racing game, sequel to Star Wars Episode I: Racer
results.name: Star Wars: Racer Revenge

results.deck: Art of Fighting Anthology is a PlayStation 2 compilation of all three Art of Fighting games.
results.name: Art of Fighting Anthology

results.deck: A compilation of the entire Monster World series.
results.name: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.29: Monster World Complete Collection

results.deck: An underground racing simulator, featuring an online mode with a pink slip system that makes racing people online more of a risk.
results.name: Juiced

results.deck:
Chaos Legion puts you in the role of a Knight of the Dark Glyphs, Seig Warheit, who has the power to summon monsters called Legions to aid him battle against hordes of enemies.
Sieg's goal is to stop his former best friend Victor Delacroix from destroying the world.
results.name: Chaos Legion

results.deck: Taito Legends 2 offers 39 more of the company's games.
results.name: Taito Legends 2

results.deck: Developed by Namco, this racing simulator brings the excitement of MotoGP to the consoles.
results.name: MotoGP

results.deck: Trapped in the Mirror Universe, Captain Sulu must get his ship safely through hostile territory and find a way back home. The player is cast as a fighter pilot defending the ship during sorties.
results.name: Star Trek: Shattered Universe

results.deck: Monster Rancher 4 is a monster-breeding simulation game where you generate monsters from the data on other CDs and DVDs and raise them to fight other monsters.
results.name: Monster Rancher 4

results.deck: Saddle up and join Barbie on a horse-rescuing adventure.
results.name: Barbie Horse Adventure: Wild Horse Rescue

results.deck: Rescue citizens trapped in burning buildings in this third-person firefighting game.
results.name: Firefighter F.D. 18

results.deck: 7 Wonders of the Ancient World is a puzzle game similar to Bejeweled, and was developed by Hot Lava Games.
results.name: 7 Wonders of the Ancient World

results.deck: A game based on the movie of the same name.
results.name: DreamWorks' Shark Tale

results.deck: Join Jaster, a young adventurer, as he is hired by space pirates to search the universe for Planet Eden, a world of untold riches and eternal life.
results.name: Rogue Galaxy

results.deck: Take control once more of the legends of wrestling.
results.name: Legends of Wrestling II

results.deck: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 2005 further refined the character creation system and added new features such as Tiger Proofing and Legends Matches
results.name: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 2005

results.deck: Guide Spongebob, Patrick, and Plankton through their Krabby Patty-induced nightmares and help them escape.
results.name: SpongeBob SquarePants: Creature From the Krusty Krab

results.deck: NBA Street is the first in a successful series of three-on-three arcade-style basketball games.
results.name: NBA Street

results.deck: Metal Arms: Glitch in the System is a third-person action game developed by Swingin' Ape Studios for the GameCube, PS2, and Xbox. As Glitch you must take up arms with the Droids of Iron Star against the evil General Corrosive.
results.name: Metal Arms: Glitch in the System

results.deck: Lucinda Green's Equestrian Challenge is a horseback riding game for the PS2 and PC.
results.name: Lucinda Green's Equestrian Challenge

results.deck:
Dr. Muto just blew up his home planet! Help him collect parts for his machine so he can rebuild his home planet.

Dr. Muto is a 3D platformer where the player takes control of Dr.Muto, a mad scientist, who uses gadgets and has the ability to morph into different animals.
results.name: Dr. Muto

results.deck: Step into the roles of the main characters, where you can use a variety of weapons, fighting techniques, weapons and stunts against enemies.
results.name: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon

results.deck: Maximo vs Army of Zin is an action adventure game developed and published by Capcom in 2003 for the PlayStation 2.  It is a direct sequel to Maximo: Ghosts to Glory.
results.name: Maximo vs Army of Zin

results.deck: Play as He-Man, on foot and astride Battle Cat, in an adventure to master the universe and defend Grayskull
results.name: Masters of the Universe: He-Man: Defender of Grayskull

results.deck: Kanon is an adult visual novel game that was released for the PC. An all ages version was released 8 months later and ported to the PS2 and Dreamcast and eventually the PSP. Themes of promises, miracles, music and amnesia play a  roll in the story.
results.name: Kanon

results.deck: Karaoke Revolution Volume 3 was the third iteration in the Karaoke Revolution series.  It was the first Karaoke Revolutions to include a Duets mode which had two separate parts to be sung at the same time.
results.name: Karaoke Revolution Volume 3

results.deck: Trapt is a PlayStation 2 strategy/action game which follows the wrongfully accused Princess Alura as she utilizes a variety of traps to defend herself from legions of assassins.
results.name: Trapt

results.deck: Fight Night Round 3 is a boxing game developed by EA Chicago that has been released on multiple platforms.
results.name: Fight Night Round 3

results.deck: A futuristic racing game released on the PlayStation 2 in 2006.
results.name: Cyclone Circus: Power Sail Racing
